{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3302251,"name":"jls667","username":"jls667","avatar_template":"/letter_avatar_proxy/v4/letter/j/c77e96/{size}.png","created_at":"2024-02-05T17:35:03.288Z","cooked":"

I am new to using vision on our robot. My SnakeEyes Hat is connected to a pi camera and a Raspberry Pi. I flashed the specific file for the SnakeEyes version. The first thing I noticed is that the SnakeEyes version is not the latest Photonvision.

  1. Does it matter that the SnakeEyes version is not the latest Photonvision?
  2. I do not think my pi is saving the calibration. Any suggestions?
  3. I do not think my pi is recognizing the Apriltags. Other people seem to get an ID number on the screen by the tag.

Howdy! We’re still working on getting a most recent build for SnakeEyes.

For now, follow the normal photonvision install instructions. The only thing that won’t work is the green LED slider, which hopefully you don’t need this year.

The AprilTag pipeline still defaults to last years’ 16h5 tags, you need to change it to 36h11 in the “AprilTag” tab.

It looks like the Photonvision looses lots of settings on my Raspberry Pi each time I reboot. The calibration disappears. The AprilTag defaults to 16h5. The new pipeline disappears. Am I missing a way to save these things, otherwise how would I use vision in a program?
